course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Introductory Biology: Cell and Developmental Biology

notes.note: Biological science majors must take this course for a letter grade. For course enrollment, visit the course website at https://courses.cit.cornell.edu/biomg1350/ or write to biomg1350@cornell.edu. Please do not e-mail course instructors directly.
Problem Solving Sessions are strongly recommended: Tuesday or Wednesday 8:30 - 10:00 AM. (3rd Session by arrangement with instructor).

Prerequisite or corequisite: BIOMG 2800; BIOG 1500 strongly recommended as pre-requisite. Not open to freshman, fall semester. Biological sciences majors must take course for a letter grade. Course has an evening prelim.Course may not be added after the 1st week of class.

Prerequisite or corequisite: BIOMG 2800; BIOG 1500 strongly recommended as pre-requisite. Not open to freshman, fall semester. Biological sciences majors must take course for a letter grade. Course has an evening prelim.Course may not be added after the 1st week of class.

Prerequisite or corequisite: BIOMG 2800; BIOG 1500 strongly recommended as pre-requisite. Not open to freshman, fall semester. Biological sciences majors must take course for a letter grade. Course has an evening prelim.Course may not be added after the 1st week of class.

Prerequisite or corequisite: BIOMG 2800; BIOG 1500 strongly recommended as pre-requisite. Not open to freshman, fall semester. Biological sciences majors must take course for a letter grade. Course has an evening prelim.Course may not be added after the 1st week of class.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 1350 or two majors level biology courses.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Principles of Biochemistry: Proteins and Metabolism

notes.note: Prerequisite: one majors-level biology course and one year general chemistry and CHEM 1570 or 3570-3580 or equivalent, or permission of instructor (CHEM 1570 or 2570 should not be taken concurrently). An optional discussion section is held on most Fridays from 2:55-3:20pm. Evening Prelim. View Prelim Schedule: http://registrar.sas.cornell.edu/Sched/exams.html.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 3330 , BIOMG 3350 , BIOMG 3310 /BIOMG 3320 (BIOMG 3320 may be taken concurrently), or corequisite: BIOMG 3300.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 3330 , BIOMG 3350 , BIOMG 3310 /BIOMG 3320 (BIOMG 3320 may be taken concurrently), or corequisite: BIOMG 3300.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 3330 , BIOMG 3350 , BIOMG 3310 /BIOMG 3320 (BIOMG 3320 may be taken concurrently), or corequisite: BIOMG 3300.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 2800 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: two majors-level biology courses and BIOMG 2800 or BIOMG 3300, or 3330, or 3350, or 3310/3320, or permission of instructor.

Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300, or 3330, or 3350, or 3310/3320, or written permission of instructor. Enrollment limited to: upper-classmen. Organizational meeting, first Tuesday of the semester, 4:30P 458 Biotech.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Regulation of Cell Proliferation, Senescence, and Death

notes.note: Prerequisite: two majors-level biology courses and BIOMG 3300, or 3330, or 3350, or 3310/3320. Recommended prerequisite: BIOMG 2800 and 4320.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Regulation of Cell Proliferation, Senescence, and Death

notes.note: Prerequisite: two majors-level biology courses and BIOMG 3300, or 3330, or 3350, or 3310/3320. Recommended prerequisite: BIOMG 2800 and 4320.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Laboratory in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

notes.note: Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300, or BIOMG 3330, or BIOMG 3350, or BIOMG 3310/BIOMG 3320 (at least one of BIOMG 3310/BIOMG 3320 completed but one may be taken concurrently). Priority given to undergraduate biology majors in Biochemistry or Molecular and Cell Biology programs of study and to graduate students with a minor in field of biochemistry. Graduate students must enroll by permission only. Limited enrollment.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Laboratory in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

notes.note: Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300, or BIOMG 3330, or BIOMG 3350, or BIOMG 3310/BIOMG 3320 (at least one of BIOMG 3310/BIOMG 3320 completed but one may be taken concurrently). Priority given to undergraduate biology majors in Biochemistry or Molecular and Cell Biology programs of study and to graduate students with a minor in field of biochemistry. Graduate students must enroll by permission only. Limited enrollment.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 2800, BIOEE 1780, or equivalents.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Concepts and Techniques in Plant Molecular Biology

notes.note: Prerequisite: BIOMG 2800 and BIOMG 3300 or BIOMG 3320, or equivalents. Recommended prerequisite: BIOMG 3310.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 2800.

Prerequisite: previous enrollment in course to be taught or equivalent. Arts students may not count this course toward graduation but may, upon petition (one time only) to their class dean, carry fewer than 12 other credits and remain in good standing. This would affect Dean's List eligibility but not eligibility for graduating with distinction. S-U or letter grades by permission of the instructor. Students from all Colleges must submit a CALS Special Studies Form (Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study). Do not sign into section 601. You will be put in the course after submitting form online.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300, or BIOMG 3330, or BIOMG 3350, or BIOMG 3310/BIOMG 3320 and organic chemistry. Recommended prerequisite: physical chemistry course.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300, or BIOMG 3330, or BIOMG 3350, or BIOMG 3310/BIOMG 3320. Recommended prerequisite: BIOMG 2800.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 2800 or equivalent, BIOMG 3300 or BIOMG 3330 or BIOMG 3350 or BIOMG 3310 or equivalent, or permission of instructor.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Current Topics in Genetics and Development

notes.note: Organization meeting TBA. Enrollment limited to: 1st year graduate students in the Field of Genetics. This class will be team-taught by multiple field faculty members.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Current Topics in Genetics and Development

notes.note: Undergraduates, written permission of instructor. Enrollment preference given to: graduate students; priority given to majors in field of genetics. No auditors.
Enrollment limited to: first year graduate students in the field of Genetics & Development.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Research Seminar in Genetics and Development

notes.note: Enrollment limited to: graduate students in Genetics & Development.
Enrollment limited to: students in Genetics & Development.
This lab-based course will be offered the week of the 4th of November; in five 2-3 hrs sessions, one per day. Timing will be discussed at an Organizational meeting.
Enrollment limited to students in the graduate field of BMCB. This class will be offered during the month of October. Class timing will be discussed at an organizational meeting.

Organization meeting TBA. Enrollment is limited to 1st year graduate students in the Field of Biochemistry, Molecular, and Cell Biology. This class will be team-taught by multiple field faculty members.

Enrollment limited to: Presidential Life Science Fellows(PLSF). An organizational meeting will be held in late August, location TBA. This course introduces participants to a wide range of Life Sciences related faculty from across the Cornell-Ithaca campus. Students will receive an overview of high-impact research being done at Cornell; such an exposure will also help students identify laboratory rotation mentors.

Enrollment limited to BMCB & GGD students. A practical guide to commonly used bioinformatics tools for sequence alignment, homolog identification, motif discovery, et al. Introduction to public genomic and proteomic databases and their applications. Hands-on exercises will be provided. Meeting time and location TBA.
Enrollment limited to: students in Biochemistry, Molecular and Cell Biology(BMCB)
Students must register for both labs. Enrollment only open to 1st year BMCB students. Organizational meeting: first Friday of the semester.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Problems in Biochemistry, Molecular, and Cell Biology

notes.note: Enrollment limited to: first semester Ph.D. students in the Graduate Field of BMCB.
